bill_title: to require adoption of a prescription drug formulary for medicaid.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require adoption of a prescription drug formulary for medicaid. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 28-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: By January 1, 1998, the Department of Social Services shall adopt, pursuant to chapter 1-26, a formulary of prescription drugs to be used in the provision of medical assistance under this chapter. The pharmacy and therapeutics (P&T) committee shall determine the prescription drugs to be included in the formulary. The P&T committee shall consist of four members appointed by the secretary of the department. The committee shall include one registered pharmacist and three licensed physicians. The persons appointed shall be involved in the day-to-day practice of medicine or pharmacy and regularly involved in providing care to medicaid recipients. The department shall adopt additional rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 as follows: (1) The criteria for including prescription drugs in and excluding prescription drugs from the formulary. The cost of a prescription drug may not be the sole reason for excluding it from the formulary; (2) Procedures for revision of the formulary at least annually; (3) A timely approval process for obtaining a prescription drug not included in the formulary when its use is medically necessary and no suitable formulary drug exists; and (4) A process for appealing decisions to exclude specific prescription drugs from the formulary.
